Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. Four women from the USA stayed at the Olimpia Hotel on the Plaza de Republic and I must say that the staff were the most offensive that we encountered in our five weeks in Europe. I asked the assistant manager if we had somehow offended him as he was extremely rude to us during our stay. He denied and said it was a language problem. Not so. Our room wouldn't lock and when we brought this to his attention he raised his voice and yelled that It's not possible for our door not to lock. At last he followed me to the room and amazingly the door didn't lock. The bathroom was a disaster with the shower head coming out of the wall, soaking the bathroom with every shower. Beds were impossible. The only saving grace was its location. I would never encourage anyone to stay at this hote unless you enjoy being mistreated.
Reviews.Author: kdixon

Reviews.Content: No way...not ever again! I stayed here with some friends for 2 nights in June. TheONLY thing going for this 2 Star hotel is the fantasticlocation...right on the Piazza Republica. Our room wasvery musty and the old fan did not work. Thankfully, theevenings were fairly cool, but in deep summer, it would bea problem. The included breakfast was just so-so...with,as the previous reviewer mentioned, terrible coffee. Thelittle bar below the hotel had fantastic coffee, though.The shower was something to behold...and be sure to takeeverything out of the room....towels, toilet paper etc. asthey will get soaked. The main problem was in discoveringthat our door did not lock. When we talked to the managerabout this, he became very angry and did not believe us.Upon showing him, he then became angrier and felt likewe had somehow broken the lock. He attempted to fixthe problem, but it could still be shoved open if you reallytried...this did not make us very comfortable leaving ourthings in the room the last day. I love Florence and thewonderful people, but would definitely not stay in this particular hotel again fantastic location or not!
Reviews.Author: NBLoneStar

Reviews.Content: Fabulous location What a great location this Hotel has. Right in the middle of all the main places you would want to visit. It is a wonder that the owners don't upgrade. The Hotel is an Italian 3 star and definately not up to 3* UK, however, it is perfectly adequate. Our room was quite small with no outlook (a stone wall to be precise)with a very strange 'wet room' with the shower in the middle which meant everything got soaked. The air con is a bit dated, the old blower radiator style which can be quite loud but it did work okay. Breakfast was basic, cereal, rolls, cake and croissants with terrible coffee. Ask for hot water as they have a good selection of teas. We found the staff really pleasant and very helpful. If you are booking I would ask for one of the front rooms as they have lovely street views and are quite large and airy.
Reviews.Author: dominomags

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Value The location was great! This hotel is right on one of the many squares in Florence. Walking distance to EVERYTHING. There were 2 couples in our room (a quad) and it was more than enough room for 4 of us. Bathroom was a little wierd, the shower is in the middle of the bathroom. The hotel was clean and the front desk was VERY helpful! They even printed out train schedules for us. Breakfast was included. Our room overlooked the square which was fantastic. And although the square is loud at night, you can't even hear a peep with the windows closed. We wound up booking a double room at the end of our trip as well to cut down on our travel time to the airport. Again, can't say enough about the location! I would definately stay here again!
Reviews.Author: Kristen24

Reviews.Content: The location single-handedly did it for me Brilliant location at the heart of Florence, helpful staff, large clean and comfortable rooms. I guess what keeps them from expanding or charging a higher rent is the fact that they are located on the 4th floor. Good 2/3 * hotel.
Reviews.Author: the_Sal_of_Man

Reviews.Content: Central Florence Hotel Perfect for what I was looking for. It was basic but good value for money as I was only staying there a few hours. Really friendly staff. Very welcoming. So central. 5 mins from train station. 5 mins from main touristy areas. Recommend it definitely!
Reviews.Author: dellala

Reviews.Content: Great Deal - Perfect Location Wow, what an amazing location! This hotel is located right on one of the biggest piazzas in Florence. You can't beat this location. At night, you are right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. Plenty of restaurants right outside the front door. Surprisingly, the morning breakfast was the most comprehensive of all six hotels we stayed at during our trip. There are croissants, cereal, yogurt, coffee, tea, fresh fruit, toast, etc. The room is clean and safe, although nothing special. You have to take one of those gated metal elevators up a few floors to get to the hotel's main floor, but don't let that bother you. If you stay at this place, you're staying here for the amazing location, not the perks of a 5-star resort.
Reviews.Author: travelaerbwa

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in Central Florence My family (wife and 3 teenage daughters) and I stayed here for 2 nights in August 2007. The hotel is located on the Piazza della Repubblica, which has several outdoor restaurants, as well as a lively street performance scene and is within blocks of the Duomo and the Uffizi. Despite our room overlooking the square, there was virtually no noise. The room was large and comfortable. The bathroom has a shower in the middle of the small room, as is the case in many older Italian bathrooms, but there is a curtain and we did not find this to be a problem. The hotel serves a good breakfast with fruits, breads, yogurt and cereal. Although the lift is quirky, it does save you from walking the 3 flights of stairs. The staff was very pleasant and spoke English. All in all, we had a great time!
Reviews.Author: jacko8212

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel In Florence HOTELS.COM said this hotel is 3 stars... IT IS THE FURTHEST THING FROM 3 stars I have ever seen. There is no lobby, there is a warehouse style elevator, you must walk up 3 flights to get to the front desk to check in, there is no clear sign, you must pass a doctor's office and other commercial offices on your way up to your room which are in the same building as your hotel. Oh and by the way there is no shower, it is just a shower head in the middle of the bathroom. It ruined our trip. This place should put shut down.
Reviews.Author: BusinessMart

Reviews.Content: Great Location You just couldn't find a better location if you want to be in the middle of it all. We were able to get to everything with leisurely walking. The Piazza has some fabulous restaurants. Street vendors are right there for you. The room we had was BIG by European standards. The AC worked all the time, there was always hot water. Breakfast was plentiful and the staff very helpful. Be aware that elevator is shared in that building so sometimes we had to wait abit. However, going down the stairs was no problem. I went up them just once! I'ld go back.
Reviews.Author: icetsarina

Reviews.Content: Great location! Location: perfect. It is in the centre of Florence, most of the attractions are in very short walking distance.Staff: very friendly, some of them dont speak English, but they can always find someone who can..Rooms: we had a very nice room on the 4th floor, with a small balcony, a small bathroom, and functional aircondition. Other: the breakfast consists of toast, jam and croissants, but that is what you get all over Italy, so it is to be expected..They let you store your luggage there after check out. Practical.
Reviews.Author: Tinki

Reviews.Content: Hated it All! I booked the hotel after seeing reviews online. When we arrived in Florence we were shocked to see the condition of the room and especially the bathroom. We could not cancel or get our money back so I figured I would tough it out. After walking around Florence for a few hours I knew I could not stay at the Hotel. My son stayed in our room and my husband and I stayed at the Savoy. It cost us a fortune for the Savoy but it was the best decision we made.
Reviews.Author: fitzkath

Reviews.Content: centrally located The Hotel Olimpia is situated in the heart of downtown florence, in the piaza republica. All of the main attractions including the uffizi, Santa Maria de Flore, Piazzo Vechio, Piazzo Pitti, Ponte Vecchio, Gallerie De Accadamia and many others are within 10 minutes walk from the Hotel. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean. The shower and the lift are a little quirky, but adds to the charm. Overall this makes an excellent home base while in florence, saving you time, money and inconvineince of commuting via cab or shuttle.
Reviews.Author: WayneCanada

Reviews.Content: Perfect Location We recently stayed here for three nights as part of a group trip to Tuscany. We were supposed to switch rooms (based on the comings and goings of part of our group) but the helpful and friendly hotel staff allowed us to keep the larger room at the lower price for all three nights. This made our experience much better as no one wanted to move luggage down the hall!The location is perfect - right in the middle of central Florence and close to the train station. The airport is only a 25 minute cab ride away (about twenty Euros) and the staff will call a taxi for you at any time. We found we could walk almost anywhere in the city in less than ten minutes.Rooms are large by European standards and have a small closet area and realtively comfy beds. Don't expect lots of amenities as this is a low-key hotel. The bathroom is tiny and the shower is literally in the doorway (with a curtain to pull around you that does not prevent the rest of the room from being soaked after your shower). This is not, we found, unusual in Italian hotels so just be prepared and you'll be fine. The room/bathroom is clean and well-looked after by the excellent housekeeping staff each day. Breakfast is very nice and included in your room rate so take advantage. Again, what you're paying for here is the location...it's right in the middle of everything. If you want to stay centrally located (and save on all those cab rides), book this hotel!
Reviews.Author: domer2007

Reviews.Content: Great choice This was our first trip to Italy and Florence was our first stop. Hotel Olimpia was a great great location. No frills but who needs them when you are in Florence and spend most of your time outside the hotel room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was hysterical. It didn't bother us at all that the toilet was in the shower and everything was very clean. Staff was helpful and have I mentioned that the location is great.We will definitely stay here again. Plus it was the cheapest place we stayed in Italy so that puts it high on the list.
Reviews.Author: laxgirl9

Reviews.Content: Quirky lift, Great Albergo On the 4th floor, access is via a 4 person lift in a cage. You've got to remember to shut all the doors before and after you've finished otherwise nothing moves. The doors open in so it'd be hard to have 4 people and luggage in at the same time.Nevertheless, we travelled with 2 83year old disabled ladies who were well accommodated. The staff and simple breakfast were top class. Rooms on the square have a fantastic view!It is so centrally located that almost all the sites are within a 10 minute walk. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!
Reviews.Author: Berkeley_Square

Reviews.Content: GREAT Location - Basic Accomodations The fantastic location of this hotel cannot be overstated; you are a very short walking distance to the Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio, and the train station. The Piazza Dell Republica out the front door is itself a historical landmark of the two first roads in Florence. The square has several nice cafes with live music, and there are shops all around you.The hotel is on the fourth floor of an older building and by no means has modern or ample amenities. The beds are very basic and thin. The breakfasts are continental (croissants, fruit, yogurt, and juice.) The bathrooms are tiny but clean. The tv's are small, but they do have cable. Air conditioning is functional. The hotel staff was amiable but not overly hospitable.If you are not looking for a lush hotel room and plan to spend your time out and about, the Olympia is a great choice for a home base due to it's perfect location. Look for a bargain on the room as we got a steal compared to other hotels with similar locations.
Reviews.Author: WillThompson

Reviews.Content: Great! This hotel was excellent. It was a large room with AC, a nice bath room, and a generous breakfast. Also, It was very cheap. Considering I am 18 and I went with my 18 year old girl friend, we wanted cheap, and we got it. Finally, what makes this hotel great is the location. It is literally in the center of everything, meters away from all the main sites. Florence itself is basically walking distance, but this hotel gives you a head start. It is a very nice feeling to be able to go back to your hotel whenever you want because it is not out of the way. Check it out on the map and you will see what I mean. The combination of those things made this hotel a top choice for Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location We stayed for 4 nights and we more than pleased. It's walking distance from the train station and the location is ideal for sightseeing. We were near the Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi, Duomo and it was great to be able to nip back to our room whenever.The bathroom was a little small but the room was clean and compared to other hotels we stayed in around Italy, it was better for the price and there was an above average selection of things for breakfast by Italian standards.Staff were friendly and even though it's right in the middle of the city, we weren't troubled by much noise. I'd definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: pentapus

Reviews.Content: Great! Perfect location; just in the middle of everything. Quiet room, large and well equiped. Very clean. Balcony with view to the Piazza della Republica. Excellent service; good breakfast.
Reviews.Author: Mildrilla

Reviews.Content: Great Holiday In Florance I have just returned from a family break in Florence, spending 5 nights at The Hotel Olimpia. The main asset of this hotel is the location and as one of our rooms faced the piazza, the evening entertainment was lovely. The 2 rooms we had were quite spacious, althought the bathrooms were on the extremely small side, but they served their purpose.The breakfast was continental style and set you up nicely till lunch time. The coffee was lovely and served promply by the staff, who were pleasant and courtious.I would say that this is a good value for money hotel, but cannot stress how good its location is.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Had a good stay! Best location in Florence!       the bathroom/shower
Reviews.Author: Bluestruck

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! I stayed on September with my husband and it was lovely!the room was quiet and very clean, the staff was helpful and the breakfast was great.Folrence is wonderful in that season.We didn't see any constructions but the building is renewed.Great location
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: We loved it! Great for the budget conscious. We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in the summer of 2004 and we simply loved it. After staying in a increadibly cramped and shady hotel in Rome (they tried to get us to go to a sister hotel in a distant part of the city until I brokedown and started crying because we were so tired). We were thrilled to come into our airy and cool room at the Olimpia.What other guests have said is true. The bathroom shower is less than ideal and the elevator is small and old, but for the price (70 Euro a night for two) it was an excellent buy.We didn't really mind the shower or elevator as we had expected them from reading other reviews and many times we just took the stairs as the hotel was only on the 3rd floor. All in all we felt that the whole atmosphere was charming and fun.The room was very comfortable if a little stark. The tile floors felt great on our feet after walking in the hot sun all day and the little balcony that looked onto the road below was wonderful. We could see the top of the duomo and a renaissance or medieval (can't remember) church was right across the road. The breakfast area looks over the Piazza Della Republica and we watched the early morning sunlight bath the surrounding buildings and the top of the duomo while we ate breakfast. The coffee was fresh and delicious and we throughly enjoyed the breakfast. (Although we are both cereal and croissant type breakfast eaters and that's pretty much what there was.)It truly was a great location. The Uffizi is only about three blocks away and the Duomo is only down the street maybe a block away. Every site we visited (except San Miniato on the hillside and maybe the Palazzo Pitti) was easily accessible by foot in about ten minutes or less. I can not stress enough how great this was. We never had to worry about cabs. We even walked (with our luggage) from the train station and didn't have a problem. (Though I must say that we are both in our early twenties, though not athletic at all. Still, for older travelers this may not be the case.) There was also a tasty and convenient little gilato and snack shop called Mio Bar right under the hotel, which was perfect for picking up sandwiches or cold pizza to take with us on our travels during the day and for getting gelato when we were hot and tired on our return trip.The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Though they spoke broken english they made their best effort to get through any minor language barriers and were always nice.We are a young couple on a tight budget so we needed something relatively cheap and we felt like we got a bargain. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, even if we weren't on such a tight budget. We would recommend Hotel Olimpia to anyone in a similar situation who isn't to concerned about the size of the bathroom shower or elevator and is just looking for a good, simple place to come home away from home.- a very satisfied, and now more worldly, Minnesota couple
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful for experiencing Florence My wife and I stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon and had a wonderful time at a reasonable price. The room was large with high ceilings (though the furnishings were not that great), the A/C worked well, the staff was helpful, and the breakfast was decent. But the highlight of our stay was the balcony. We had just enough room to squeeze two chairs on it and people watch. Hotel Olimpia is right on Piazza della Republicca, and our balcony was on the street running into the piazza, going towards the Uffizzi. At night we could hear the musicians, watch the street performers, and feel like we were a part of the night life all from the comfort of our room! The other great thing about this hotel is the location: you can walk everywhere you want to go in under 15 minutes, and the Uffizzi and the Duomo are less than 100 meters away. Overall, this is a nice hotel in a great location, which allows you to experience Florence the right way!
Reviews.Author: mmk8a

Reviews.Content: Under Construction Just a word to our fellow travellers....My husband and I stayed at Hotel Olimpia a few years ago and wanted to stay there again this year. I agree with the most recent reviews and we loved our room and location. The hotel is currently under construction and almost every window is covered in tarps. I am not sure about the inside status because we were unable to get a room. One of the best things about this hotel is its view and nightlife. The construction is something you might want to check on as you make your reservations.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ok hotel When we reached there on a hot summer afternoon, the elevators were not working. The hotel is situated on 4th floor and we had to take the stairs with all our luggage. So the first impression was not good. The room was spacious for a change unlike other hotels of Europe. The floor of the bathroom gets wet if you take a shower. Breakfast was ok if not great.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Find After spending time in Rome, my wife and I moved up to Florence and stayed 3 days at Hotel Olimpia. The front desk staff spoke good english and was very helpful.I was very happy with our choice of this hotel. Yes the shower is a bit laughable, its just a curtain on a circular ring in the middle of the bathroom. So what, you're in Florence for God sake! The floor had a drain and after staying in 5 hotels all over Italy, almost every bathroom is similar to this, their hotels are just different than Americans are used to. The room itself was clean and very nice. 20-foot high ceilings never hurt. The hotel's location couldn't be beat, a 6 euro cab ride from the train station and only 2 blocks from the Duomo. Everything is within walking distance from this hotel. Plus the Piazza Republica comes alive at night. One of the best meals we had on the trip was at the jazz cafe across the piazza from the hotel. I would not hesitate at all to stay here again.
Reviews.Author: G0Sabres

Reviews.Content: Location Location Location!!!! This is a quirky little place, more like a 2 star back-packer hotel. First off, it's located in a no parking zone, so access is a problem if you have a car anyway. Plus, a garage has to come get your car and you pay 25E/night for that (typical in Italy). The driving directions were a little hard to follow as well. Then, once you found the building, you took a (service?) elevator up to the fourth floor or so, which is where the hotel lobby is located. In the rooms, the shower was not separated from the rest of the bathroom, so you could do your business and shower at the same time if you wanted to -- I'm not sure whether that's a positive or negative!OK, but once you are THERE, the location is right ON the Piazza del Republica, and that is definitely where you want to be in Florence (Ask for one of the rooms looking down on the piazza). You are within a ten minute walk to just about anywhere (David, Uffizi, Duomo, train station, Ponte Vecchio), and the night life (street performers, restaurants, etc.) in the piazza is great. We didn't spend a nickel any night for entertainment (OK, except for multitudinous gelatos), and had a great time.The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, although the second shift guys weren't too English proficient (but we always got whatever we needed). The continental breakfast was also weaker than most the 3-4 star hotels we stayed in. But our rooms were ready when we arrived, and the price paid was the price agreed upon online.All in all, for $100 a night to be right on the Piazza Republica, it was OK. I'd stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great stay in Florence   showReview(2523814, 'full');
Reviews.Author: blip

Reviews.Content: ok hotel, great location   showReview(2122336, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Tricia123

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Horrible Bathroom   showReview(2094522, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Good value!   showReview(1899918, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Great Location, April 2004   showReview(1871036, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Great location for an okay hotel   showReview(1785536, 'full');

Reviews.Content: We loved it   showReview(1503271, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Posizone eccellente, vista interessante   showReview(21080613, 'full');
